questions: What is meant by magnetic field ?
answers: The region surrounding a magnet in which the force of the magnet can be detected is said to be its magnetic field.

questions: Define magnetic field of bar magnet.
answers: Magnetic field around the bar magnet is the region in which magnetic force due to bar magnet can be experienced.

questions: What is the direction of the magnetic field lines inside a bar magnet ?
answers: Inside a bar magnet is South to North.

questions: What is the direction of the magnetic field lines outside a bar magnet ?
answers: Outside a bar magnet is North to South.

questions: Define the term ‘induced current’.
answers: It is the electric current which originates in a conductor by use of fluctuating magnetic field around the conductor.

questions: Why are magnetic field lines more crowded towards the pole of a magnet ?
answers: This indicates that the magnetic field in that region is strong.

questions: Why does a compass needle show deflection when brought near a current carrying conductor ?
answers: Due to production of magnetic field around the current carrying conductor.

questions: Why does two magnetic field lines not intersect ?
answers: Magnetic field lines never intersect because for intersection there must be two north directions at a point, which is not possible.

questions: When a current carrying conductor is kept in a magnetic field, state the position when maximum force acts on it.
answers: The force experienced by a current carrying conductor placed in a magnetic field is the maximum when conductor is kept perpendicular to the direction of the magnetic field.

questions: State the effect of a magnetic field on the path of a moving charged particle.

questions: State the observation made by Oersted on the basis of his experiment with current carrying conductors.
answers: The strength of the magnetic field increases.

questions: State the conclusions that can be drawn from the observation that a current carrying wire deflects a magnetic needle placed near it.
answers: A magnetic field exists around it.

answers: Strength of the magnetic field falls as distance increases. This is indicated by the decrease in degree of closeness of the lines of field.
